seo.title: Only hostel in Positano: what to expect (and how to save)
seo.description: Lean into our uniqueness: terrace views, bus‑stop proximity, bar and breakfast — plus direct booking tips to save.

linkLabel: Only hostel in Positano: what to expect (and how to save)
intro: Welcome to Positano’s only hostel. Expect friendly vibes, a panoramic terrace to sip your morning coffee, and an unbeatable location right by the SITA bus stop at Chiesa Nuova.

sections.title: Room types and bedding
body: Shared dorms sleep 4–8 people with individual reading lights, outlets, and lockers—bring a TSA padlock or buy one at reception.
Private rooms come in en-suite and shared-bath formats; request a balcony or sea view when you email the team if that matters to you.

sections.title: Common areas and services
body: The terrace has tables, loungers, and power outlets so you can eat, plan routes, or join sunset aperitivo events without leaving the property.
The lobby bar serves coffee, spritz, and local wine; a seasonal breakfast buffet runs roughly 07:30–10:00—check the chalkboard for the daily menu.

sections.title: Booking and policies
body: Book direct on hostelbrikette.com to unlock the lowest flexible rate; third-party OTAs charge more and have stricter change rules.
A small deposit secures your bed; cancellations are free up to the published deadline—message the team if your travel plans shift so they can adjust housekeeping.

sections.title: What’s nearby
body: Within 2 minutes you have a minimarket, bakery, and the SITA stop at Chiesa Nuova; grab snacks before the last buses sell out.
Follow Via Pasitea downhill for restaurants and gelato; allow 10–12 minutes to reach Spiaggia Grande via the main road with minimal stairs.

arrivalText: We’re ~80 m from the “Chiesa Nuova” SITA stop with no staircases en route. Arriving by ferry? Consider a porter or the SITA bus uphill.

Label fridge items; tidy tables after use; keep shared spaces welcoming.
